javadoc:
Table implementation class.
 NOTE: Most public methods are synchronized on the associated DBHandle instance
 to prevent concurrent modification by multiple threads.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new or existing Table.

params.name: tableRecord
params.comment: master table record for this table.

methods.javadoc: Return the database handle used by this table.
methods.name: getDBHandle
methods.comment: Return the database handle used by this table.

methods.name: useLongKeys
methods.comment: Determine if this table uses long keys.

return.comment:
true if this table utilizes long keys.  If false, the table uses 
 a Field type key.

methods.javadoc:
Callback notification indicating that the tableRecord has been
 changed by the masterTable.  This method is called via the MasterTable
 following an undo or redo.
methods.name: tableRecordChanged
methods.comment:
Callback notification indicating that the tableRecord has been
 changed by the masterTable.  This method is called via the MasterTable
 following an undo or redo.

methods.javadoc:
Mark table as invalid.
 Subsequent table use may generate an exception.
methods.name: invalidate
methods.comment:
Mark table as invalid.
 Subsequent table use may generate an exception.

methods.name: getTableNum
methods.comment: Get this tables master table number.

return.comment:
table number for this table.  Each table has a unique table 
 number within the master table.

methods.javadoc:
Get table statistics.
@return list of diagnostic statistics data for this table and related index tables.
methods.name: getAllStatistics
methods.comment: Get table statistics.

return.comment: list of diagnostic statistics data for this table and related index tables.

methods.name: accumulateNodeStatistics
methods.comment: Accumulate node statistics

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: getStatistics
methods.comment: Compile table statitics.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Add an existing secondary index.
 NOTE: Records for this table instance must not be modified until
 after all existing secondary indexes are added.  Failure to comply may
 result in an inconsistent index.
@param indexTable secondary index table
methods.name: addIndex
methods.comment:
Add an existing secondary index.
 NOTE: Records for this table instance must not be modified until
 after all existing secondary indexes are added.  Failure to comply may
 result in an inconsistent index.

methods.name: insertedRecord
methods.comment:
Callback method for when a new record is added.
 Used for maintaining indexes only.  May be called before 
 the old record is actually inserted.

methods.name: updatedRecord
methods.comment:
Callback method for when an existing record is modified.
 Used for maintaining indexes only.  May be called before 
 the old record is actually updated.

methods.name: deletedRecord
methods.comment:
Callback method for when existing records are deleted.
 Used for maintaining indexes only.  May be called before 
 the old record is actually deleted.

methods.name: rebuild
methods.comment: Rebuild table and associated indexes to ensure consistent state.

throws.comment: if unable to rebuild

methods.name: isConsistent
methods.comment: Check the consistency of this table and its associated index tables.

return.comment: true if consistency check passed, else false

methods.javadoc: Delete all records within this table.
methods.name: deleteAll
methods.comment: Delete all records within this table.

methods.javadoc:
Get the list of columns which are indexed
@return list of indexed columns
methods.name: getIndexedColumns
methods.comment: Get the list of columns which are indexed

methods.name: removeIndex
methods.comment: Remove the index associated with the specified column.

methods.javadoc:
Get this tables schema.
@return table schema
methods.name: getSchema
methods.comment: Get this tables schema.

methods.javadoc:
Get table name
@return table name
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Get table name

methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Change the name of this table

methods.javadoc:
Get record count
@return record count
methods.name: getRecordCount
methods.comment: Get record count

methods.javadoc:
Get the maximum record key which has ever been assigned within this table.
 This method is only valid for those tables which employ a long key and may
 not reflect records which have been removed (i.e., returned key may not 
 correspond to an existing record).
@return maximum record key.
methods.name: getMaxKey
methods.comment:
Get the maximum record key which has ever been assigned within this table.
 This method is only valid for those tables which employ a long key and may
 not reflect records which have been removed (i.e., returned key may not 
 correspond to an existing record).

methods.name: getKey
methods.comment:
Get the next available key.
 This method is only valid for those tables which employ a long key.

methods.name: hasRecord
methods.comment: Determine if this table contains a record with the specified key.

return.comment: true if record exists with key, else false.

methods.name: hasRecord
methods.comment: Determine if this table contains a record with the specified key.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment: true if record exists with key, else false.

methods.name: getRecord
methods.comment: Get the record identified by the specified key value.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
Record the record identified by key, or null if record was not
 found.

methods.name: getRecord
methods.comment: Get the record identified by the specified key value.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
Record the record identified by key, or null if record was not
 found.

methods.name: getRecordBefore
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value less than the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value less than the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordBefore
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value less than the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value less than the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAfter
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value greater than the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value greater than the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAfter
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value greater than the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value greater than the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAtOrBefore
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value less than or equal to the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value less than or equal to the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAtOrBefore
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value less than or equal to the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value less than or equal to the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAtOrAfter
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value greater than or equal to the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value greater than or equal to the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: getRecordAtOrAfter
methods.comment:
Get the first record which has a key value greater than or equal to the 
 specified key.

params.name: key
params.comment: unique key which may or may not exist within the table.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment:
the first record which has a key value greater than or equal to the 
 specified key, or null if no record was found.

methods.name: putRecord
methods.comment: Put the specified record into the stored BTree.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

methods.name: putLongKeyRecord
methods.comment: Store a record which uses a long key

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

methods.name: putVarKeyRecord
methods.comment: Store a record which uses a Field key

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

methods.name: deleteRecord
methods.comment: Delete a record identified by the specified key value.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment: true if record was deleted successfully.

methods.name: deleteRecord
methods.comment: Delete a record identified by the specified key value.

throws.comment: throw if an IO Error occurs

return.comment: true if record was deleted successfully.

methods.name: deleteRecords
methods.comment: Delete all records whose keys fall within the specified range, inclusive.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

return.comment: true if one or more records were deleted.

methods.name: deleteRecords
methods.comment: Delete all records whose keys fall within the specified range, inclusive.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

return.comment: true if one or more records were deleted.

methods.name: findRecords
methods.comment:
Find the primary keys corresponding to those records which contain the
 specified field value in the specified record column.  The table must
 have been created with a secondary index on the specified column index.

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the record schema column which should be searched.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: getMatchingRecordCount
methods.comment:
Get the number of records which contain the
 specified field value in the specified record column.  The table must
 have been created with a secondary index on the specified column index.

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the record schema column which should be searched.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

return.comment: number of records which match the specified field value.

methods.name: hasRecord
methods.comment:
Determine if a record exists with the specified value within the specified
 column.  The table must have been created with a secondary index on the 
 specified column index.

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the record schema column which should be searched.

return.comment: true if one or more records exis with the specified value.

methods.name: indexFieldIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over all the unique index field values.  Index values are
 returned in an ascending sorted order with the initial iterator position
 set to the minimum index value.

methods.name: indexFieldIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over all the unique index field values within the specified range identified
 by minField and maxField.  Index values are returned in an ascending sorted order.

params.name: minField
params.comment: minimum index column value, if null absolute minimum is used

params.name: maxField
params.comment: maximum index column value, if null absolute maximum is used

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before minField, else position
 is after maxField

methods.name: indexFieldIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over all the unique index field values within the specified range identified
 by minField and maxField.  Index values are returned in an ascending sorted order with the 
 initial iterator position corresponding to the startField.

params.name: minField
params.comment: minimum index column value, if null absolute minimum is used

params.name: maxField
params.comment: maximum index column value, if null absolute maximum is used

params.name: startField
params.comment: index column value corresponding to initial position of iterator

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before startField value, else position
 is after startField value

methods.name: indexIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column.  This table must have been constructed with a secondary
 index on the specified column.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over a range of records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column. The iterator is initially positioned before the startValue.
 This table must have been constructed with a secondary index on the specified column.

params.name: startValue
params.comment: the starting and minimum value of the secondary index field.

params.name: endValue
params.comment: the ending and maximum value of the secondary index field.

params.name: atStart
params.comment:
if true, position the iterator before the start value. 
 Otherwise, position the iterator after the end value.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexIteratorAfter
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column.  The iterator's initial position immediately follows 
 the specified startValue. If this value does not exist, the initial position corresponds
 to where it would exist.
 This table must have been constructed with a secondary index on the specified column.

params.name: startValue
params.comment: the starting value of the secondary index field.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexIteratorBefore
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column.  The iterator's initial position immediately precedes 
 the specified startValue. If this value does not exist, the initial position corresponds
 to where it would exist.
 This table must have been constructed with a secondary index on the specified column.

params.name: startValue
params.comment: the starting value of the secondary index field.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexIteratorAfter
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column.  The iterator's initial position immediately follows 
 the specified startValue and primaryKey. If no such entry exists, the initial position 
 corresponds to where it would exist.
 
 This table must have been constructed with a secondary index on the specified column.

params.name: startValue
params.comment: the starting value of the secondary index field.

params.name: primaryKey
params.comment: the primary key associated with the startField.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexIteratorBefore
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records using a secondary index.  Sorting occurs on the
 specified schema column.  The iterator's initial position immediately precedes 
 the specified startValue and primaryKey. If no such entry exists, the initial position 
 corresponds to where it would exist.
 
 This table must have been constructed with a secondary index on the specified column.

params.name: startValue
params.comment: the starting value of the secondary index field.

params.name: primaryKey
params.comment: the primary key associated with the startField.

throws.comment:
if a secondary index does not exist for the specified
 column, or the wrong field type was specified, or an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: indexKeyIterator
methods.comment: Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIteratorBefore
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is initially positioned before the first index buffer whose index key 
 is greater than or equal to the specified startField value.

params.name: startField
params.comment: index column value which determines initial position of iterator

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIteratorAfter
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is initially positioned after the index buffer whose index key 
 is equal to the specified startField value or immediately before the first 
 index buffer whose index key is greater than the specified startField value.

params.name: startField
params.comment: index column value which determines initial position of iterator

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIteratorBefore
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is initially positioned before the primaryKey within the index buffer 
 whose index key is equal to the specified startField value or immediately before the first 
 index buffer whose index key is greater than the specified startField value.

params.name: startField
params.comment: index column value which determines initial position of iterator

params.name: primaryKey
params.comment: initial position within index buffer if index key matches startField value.

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIteratorAfter
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is initially positioned after the primaryKey within the index buffer 
 whose index key is equal to the specified startField value or immediately before the first 
 index buffer whose index key is greater than the specified startField value.

params.name: startField
params.comment: index column value which determines initial position of iterator

params.name: primaryKey
params.comment: initial position within index buffer if index key matches startField value.

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is limited to range of index keys of minField through maxField, inclusive.
 If atMin is true, the iterator is initially positioned before the first index 
 buffer whose index key is greater than or equal to the specified minField value. 
 If atMin is false, the iterator is initially positioned after the first index 
 buffer whose index key is less than or equal to the specified maxField value.

params.name: atMin
params.comment:
if true, position iterator before minField value, 
 Otherwise, position iterator after maxField value.

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: indexKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over all primary keys sorted based upon the associated index key.
 The iterator is limited to range of index keys of minField through maxField, inclusive.
 The iterator is initially positioned before or after the specified startField index value.

params.name: before
params.comment: if true positioned before startField value, else positioned after maxField

throws.comment: thrown if IO error occurs

methods.name: iterator
methods.comment: Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order.  Sorting occurs on the primary key value.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: iterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order.  Sorting occurs on the primary key value
 starting at the specified startKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: iterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order.  Sorting occurs on the primary key value
 starting at the specified startKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: iterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order.  Sorting occurs on the primary key value
 starting at the specified startKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: iterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order.  Sorting occurs on the primary key value
 starting at the specified startKey.

params.name: minKey
params.comment: the minimum primary key, may be null.

params.name: startKey
params.comment: the initial iterator position, if null minKey is also start.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: longKeyIterator
methods.comment: Iterate over all long primary keys in ascending sorted order.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: longKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the long primary keys in ascending sorted order
 starting at the specified startKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: longKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the long primary keys in ascending sorted order
 starting at the specified startKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: fieldKeyIterator
methods.comment: Iterate over all primary keys in ascending sorted order.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: fieldKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the primary keys in ascending sorted order
 starting at the specified startKey.

params.name: startKey
params.comment: the first primary key.  If null the minimum key value will be assumed.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: fieldKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order
 starting at the specified startKey.

params.name: minKey
params.comment: minimum key value.  Null corresponds to minimum key value.

params.name: maxKey
params.comment: maximum key value.  Null corresponds to maximum key value.

params.name: startKey
params.comment:
the initial iterator position.  If null minKey will be assumed,
 if still null the minimum key value will be assumed.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.name: fieldKeyIterator
methods.comment:
Iterate over the records in ascending sorted order
 starting at the specified startKey.

params.name: minKey
params.comment: minimum key value.  Null corresponds to minimum key value.

params.name: maxKey
params.comment: maximum key value.  Null corresponds to maximum key value.

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before minKey, else position
 is after maxKey.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs.

methods.javadoc: @return
methods.name: isInvalid

name: Table
comment:
Table implementation class.
 NOTE: Most public methods are synchronized on the associated DBHandle instance
 to prevent concurrent modification by multiple threads.
